resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: The caricaturist chose to reconcile two drawings of a family reunion, respectively before and after their debate about the Dreyfus Affair. It illustrates the deep scission of France, not only in the military, social, political and religious spheres, but also in the private sphere.
resource.chars: The caricaturist chose to reconcile two drawings of a family reunion, respectively before and after their debate about the Dreyfus Affair. It illustrates the deep scission of France, not only in the military, social, political and religious spheres, but also in the private sphere.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: The family was the symbol of union. The various members were gathered to share a meal.
resource.chars: The family was the symbol of union. The various members were gathered to share a meal.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text:
Caran d’Ache (1858-1909)

He was a French caricaturist of Russian ancestry. In 1898, he co-founded an "anti-dreyfusard" satirical weekly entitled Psst…!
resource.chars:
Caran d’Ache (1858-1909)

He was a French caricaturist of Russian ancestry. In 1898, he co-founded an "anti-dreyfusard" satirical weekly entitled Psst…!

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: The virulence of the debates was represented by verbal aggressions, bare-knuckle confrontations, strangulations in his own family and overthrows of the table and chairs.
resource.chars: The virulence of the debates was represented by verbal aggressions, bare-knuckle confrontations, strangulations in his own family and overthrows of the table and chairs.

resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: <a style="color: #000000;" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Le_Figaro" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Le Figaro <span style="color: #000000;">was founded in 1826. This newspaper has a right and centre-right editorial line. The "Dreyfusard" movement was born in the daily’s premises. It was hosted by Bernard Lazare, Mathieu Dreyfus, Joseph Reinach and Auguste Scheurer-Kestner.
resource.chars: Le Figaro was founded in 1826. This newspaper has a right and centre-right editorial line. The "Dreyfusard" movement was born in the daily’s premises. It was hosted by Bernard Lazare, Mathieu Dreyfus, Joseph Reinach and Auguste Scheurer-Kestner.
